client.description: Temperature Sensor and Self Refresh Client
Generator spine l and r Client

chain.name: ACTM1
chain.description: ACTM DA on/off, ACTM on/off, Scrambler on/off, Bleeder on/off, compression rate, TMBCRDIS on/off, DCTL & DCTL2

chain.name: ACTM2
chain.description: ACTM topo - YC, YD, YA, YB, XWR, XRD

chain.name: TempSensRD
chain.description: Read self test and temperature value

chain.name: OcdCalRD
chain.description: Read out of pfet and nfet strengths (tm_ocdget)

variable.description: Activation Burn In functionnalities
Enable redpad interface on component level
Sequency run over half number of banks (bits 2-0 from sequecer)
Bank address in single bank mode
Activate internal sequential ACT
Activate internal sequential PRE
Activate internal sequential RD
Activate internal sequential WR
Column counter modulo setting
Row counter modulo setting
Burn In scramble setting
Activate downward column bank counting
Activate downward row bank counting
Activate downward column counting
Activate downward row counting
Activate redundancy access
Number of NOPs between two Activate/Precharge commands in staggered mode
Number of NOPs between two Write commands in staggered mode
Number of NOPs between two Read commands in staggered mode
Row bank address
State machine row state
Redpad redundancy row address
Redpad main array row address
Column bank address
State machine column state
Redpad redundancy column address
Redpad main array cloumn address
Allow read-out of various signals of DQs or the signals selected with TMPLLDIGMUX on dbi_n<0> and dbi_n<2>
Activate read-out of Self Refresh Frequency or Ring Oscillator on DQ25 depending on TMIDSRFMESEL
Allow refresh of all 8 banks simultaneously
Go into self refresh mode independently of CKE pin
Activate simultaneously all banks or half of the banks as defined by TMHALFG and TMGROUP
Use external addresses for CBR commands
Testmode not useful for 512MGV70. Value has to be set to 01 when TMACTALL, TMWRBNKSâ¦ are used.
Extend tRAS during CBR
Generate short CAS pulse.
Enable TMRS commands (i.e. setting of TMs) with any bank active
Reset Row Address Counter
Shortens CSL pulse, CSL pulse stops on the falling edge of internal clock before the normal rising edge.
Write burst simultaneously to all or half of the banks depending on TMGROUP.
Operate a new sensing of the fuses.
Enables OCD slow-mode to reduce OCD Vddq current consumption. Disables OCD high speed functionnality, data speed reduced to max 500 Mbps.
Testmode not useful for 512MGV70. Default fuse value 01.
Modify the delay of write with autoprecharge between write and precharge
Switch off the isolator devices between BL and SA.
Activate SDT eternity mode
Allow access to Redundancy WL and BL depending on abi_n value
Activate the possible usage of TMEXTADRAPTX in DA mode
Allow access to Redundancy WL and BL in DA mode
Activates BI mode
Enable output control of DQs with abi_n. abi_n=0 : DQ=Tristate, abi_n=1 : DQ=driving. Testmode works only in combination with TMACTM in DD01 and DD02.
Enable the termination bleeder for Burn -in operation (Redpad automatically switch on the bleeder)
ACTM compression selection (00-> 256:4 / 01-> 256:1 / 10-> 256:64 / 11-> FBM)
FBM data out select
Enable ACTM
Enable ACTM scrambler
Switch off automatic reset of P/F bit at burst end, if the testmode is disabled the pass/fail information is resetted
Select between registers YA or YB and YC or YD
Select between YA/YB and YC/YD
Set ACTM XWR register
Set ACTM XRD register
Set ACTM YA register
Set ACTM YB register
Set ACTM YC register
Set ACTM YD register
Enable self-test of AD converter (ADC) of the temperature sensor
Allow to soft set the offset of the temperature sensor
Allow to soft set the slope of the temperature sensor
Selftest ADC-Pass 1 (pass) / 0 (fail) - Reads out Temperature 0 (32ms) / 1 (8ms) - Temperature read-out loaded with command ts_load
Applies the offset bits shipped in with TMSHIFTOFFSET to the receiver samplers
Allows the interface to ship in the values for TMSETOFFSET or TMDQHOLD
Shorts VSS and VSSQ
Sets the pfet and nfet strengths for the OCDs
Enables the values coming from TMOCDSET
Serially ships out the OCD pfet and nfet strengths
Allow access to Redundancy WL and BL
Allow to activate odd/even/all wordlines simultaneously
Adjust delay for internal column access timing
Modify the read-write timing of the SSA
Modify the sensing time of the SSA
Writes Vbleq to a cell when a WL is active instead of Vblh or Gnd
Delay RAVLD (and BNKSEL) by a fixed delay of approximately 600ps (both rising and falling edge)
Shifts falling edge of RAVLD signal.
Allow the simultaneous activation of several wordlines.
Activate LPST mode (when TMSALTC activated). ACT activates new worlines and PRE does not release activated wordlines.
Activate sense amplifier toggling mode when TMSALTC activated.
Allow the modification of the Equalizer timing, i.e. the time at which the sense amplifier is disabled (and equalizing/precharge is started) after a wordline is deactivated.
Sets the Signal Development Time
Select read-out of Self Refresh Frequency or Ring Oscillator (left or right)
Trimming of the self-refresh oscillator
Trimming of the self-refresh frequency divider
Trimming of temperature independent Iref
Trimming of temperature dependent Iref
Trimming of Vref global
Trimming of vref_bgr (bandgap reference voltage level mismatch)
Trimming of vref_bgr( bandgap reference voltage to temperature characteristic mismatchs)
Connect Pad XVREF pad to internal VBGREF net: force & measure VBGREF
Switch feedback of Vpp, Vas, Veql from central to local feedback.
Keep Vblh generator in active mode
Disable Vbb generator (back bias voltage in array)
Trimming of Vbb (back bias voltage in array)
Disable Vblh generator (array voltage bitline-high)
Trimming of Vblh (array voltage bitline-high)
Disable Vnwll (negative WL low)
Trimming of Vnwll (negative WL low)
Enable voltage monitoring via VMON pad
Enable voltage monitoring via ZQ pin
Disable Vpp generator
Coarse trimming of Vpp
Fine trimming of Vpp
Connects GND together
Connects VINT domains together

Allows VREF_VINT voltage to track or not track with VEXT within the range of 0V to 1.55V. If this TM is enabled, then when VEXT reaches 1.35V the VREF_VINT voltage will be kept constant at 1.30V or any further increase of VEXT. If this TM is disabled then VREF_VINT will track with VEXT till the last reaches 1.55V.

Allows VREF_VINT voltage to track or not with VEXT for voltages greater than 1.65V at VEXT. If this TM is enabled, when VEXT goes beyond 1.65V VREF_VINT tracks with it. If this TM is disabled then VREF_VINT be kept constant at 1.30V.
Disable Vint generator
Trimming of Vref_Vint for margin test
Trimming of Vref pump

Allows VREF_VINT voltage to track or not track with VEXT within the range of 1.55V to 1.65V. If this TM is enabled, then when VEXT increases VREF_VINT does also track with it. If this TM is disabled then for any value of VEXT between 1.55V and 1.65V VREF_VINT will be kept fixed at 1.30V.
Shifts the tracking start and tracking end voltage, when in combination with TMVINTNOTRACK enabled.
Allows an additionally offset of the Vint (additionally to the normal trimmings), when in combination with TMVINTNOTRACK enabled, and TMVINTVDD disabled.
Disable Vas generator/pump
Coarse trimming of Vas
Disables Veql generator
Trimming of Veql
Regulates the oscillator frequency of all negative pumps (vnwl, vbb)
Regulates the oscillator frequency of all positive pumps (vpp,vas,veql)
Connects Vrefd pad to PLL
Shorten Vbleq and Vblh nets
Connect the Vbleq net to Vss
Disable VBLEQ generator (BL-equalize-voltage)
Trimming of Vbleq
Shorten Vpl and Vblh nets
Connect Vpl net to ground
Disable Vpl generator
Trimming of Vpl

Select PLL output/bypass factor. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\
Apply to the DQs the hold patterns shipped in with TMSHIFTOFFSET

Select PLL external feedback. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Select PLL reference divider factor. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Select PLL feedback factor. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Select PLL charge pump current, it does not affect what is read with TMPLLANAMUX. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Select PLL loopfilter resistor. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Select PLL VCO range/gain. For testmode activation TMPLLTESTON is required. For more details see PLL Documentation: \\MUCSDN18\MP_Graphics\PM_Components\Programs\GDDR5\2_Design&Layout\Block_Level_Specifications\WCK_PLL_Tree\

Digital test output signal select (mux): [00] => tm_dig_out = unused (static low) [01] => tm_dig_out = VCO output clock [10] => tm_dig_out = divided âclkfb_inâ at PFD [11] => tm_dig_out = divided âclkrefâ at PFD

Analog test input/output signal select (mux): [00] => v_ana_io = unused (static low) [01] => v_ana_io = mirrored CP bias current (20uA), this is the reference current not affected by TMPLLCPCURR [10] => v_ana_io = force VCO input voltage (open loop, must also set âtm_freerunâ = 1) [11] => v_ana_io = sense buffered LF voltage (closed loop, must also set âtm_freerunâ = 0)
Free running mode select (open loop at VCO): [0] => open loop disabled [1] => open loop enable
Enable pll testmodes activation
Delay WCK or CK for WCK is early or late information on EDC pins.
Increase the receivers delays for addresses, commands and CK clock.
Disable receiver preamble function to allow calibration of the receivers' samplers (with TMSHIFOFFSET and TMSETOFFSET)
Delay DBI results on DBI and CRC level
Short OCD time domains together to improve output slew rate for low Vddq
Activate OCD pre-emphasis to improve high frequency data eye
ChipID read-out (ChipID is 90 bits long, fisrt 2 bits don't care)

command.description: Resets all SETI chains, except PUQuad* and VintCfg chains. Sticky bits are not affected.
Temperature 0 (32ms) / 1 (8ms) - Selftest ADC-Pass read-out; 1 bit pass/fail flag - Temperature read-out
